Package space.sunqian.fs.cache

Class AbstractSimpleCache<K,V>

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.fs.cache.AbstractSimpleCache<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - the key type
V - the value type
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimpleCache<K,V>
public abstract class AbstractSimpleCache<K,V> extends Object implements SimpleCache<K,V>
This is a skeletal implementation of SimpleCache to minimize the effort required to implement the interface. To implement a cache, just need to override the generate(Object, Object) and SimpleCache.clean().

This implementation is based on an underlying ConcurrentMap, which is a protected field: cacheMap. The type of cacheMap's value is AbstractSimpleCache.Value, which wraps the actual value to be cached. Every time this cache is invoked, SimpleCache.clean() is executed to clear expired values. Therefore, it is necessary to correctly implement the storage and invalidation behavior of cached data in generate(Object, Object) and SimpleCache.clean().

    • get

      @Nullable public V get(@Nonnull K key, @Nonnull @Nonnull Function<? super @Nonnull K,? extends @Nullable V> producer)
      Description copied from interface: SimpleCache
      Returns the value for the specified key. If the value is invalid, the producer will be called to generate a new value, and the new value will be cached and returned. If an exception is thrown during the generation, the exception will be thrown directly. This operation is atomic.

      Any value, including null, generated by the producer will be cached. To distinguish between null value or no-cached, try SimpleCache.getVal(Object, Function).

      Specified by:
      get in interface SimpleCache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      producer - the producer to generate new value
      Returns:
      the value for the specified key, including null

    • getVal

      @Nullable public @Nullable Val<V> getVal(@Nonnull K key, @Nonnull @Nonnull Function<? super @Nonnull K,? extends @Nullable Val<? extends @Nullable V>> producer)
      Description copied from interface: SimpleCache
      Returns the value wrapped by Val for the specified key. If the value is invalid, the producer will be called to generate a new value wrapped by Val, and the new value will be cached and returned. If an exception is thrown during the generation, the exception will be thrown directly. This operation is atomic.

      If the producer generates a null, no value will be cached, and this method will return null.

      Specified by:
      getVal in interface SimpleCache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      producer - the producer to generate new value wrapped by Val
      Returns:
      the value wrapped by Val for the specified key, or null if the producer generates a null
